explanations.unsupervised learning: The paper uses principal component analysis (PCA) and K-means clustering, which are unsupervised learning techniques, to group households based on their vulnerability to climate change.
explanations.clustering: The study employs K-means clustering to categorize households into three groups: extremely vulnerable, moderately vulnerable, and resilient.
explanations.principal components analysis: PCA is used to reduce the dimensionality of the data by identifying five principal components from 14 key variables, which helps in understanding the underlying structure of the data.
